{{also|Viel}} ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/vil/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-viel.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|nl|il}} ===Verb=== {{head|nl|verb form}} # {{nl-verb form of|n=sg|t=past|m=ind|vallen}} ===Anagrams=== * {{l|nl|veil}} * {{l|nl|vlei}} ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Viel}} {{qual|for the pronoun}} ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|pelh₁}} From {{inh|de|goh|filu||many}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*felu}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*pelh₁-}}. More at {{m|en|fele}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/fiːl/}} * {{audio|de|De-viel.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|iːl}} * {{homophones|de|fiel}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun}} # [[much]], [[a lot]] #: {{ux|de|Es ist '''viel''' passiert.|t='''Much''' has happened.}} ====Usage notes==== * Compare the similar, but semantically different pronoun {{m|de|vieles}}. ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|mehr|meisten}} # [[much]], [[many]] #: {{ux|de|[[er|Er]] [[haben|hat]] '''viel''' [[Geld]] [[verloren]].|t=He lost a lot of money.}} #: {{seeCites|de}} ====Declension==== * In the singular, the adjective is usually left unchanged when it is not preceded by an article or determiner (see example sentence above). Otherwise it is declined like a normal adjective: ''das viel'''e''' Geld''. * In the plural, the adjective is usually declined even without a preceding article or determiner: ''viele Kinder''. However, it may be left unchanged when modified by a preceding adverb, e.g. in the combinations {{m|de|wie}} ''viel'' (“how many”) and {{m|de|so}} ''viel'' (“so many”): ''wie viel Kinder'' or ''wie viele Kinder''. * The comparative form {{m|de|mehr}} is invariable and never declined; it cannot be preceded by any article or determiner (note however {{m|de|mehrere}}, {{m|de|mehreres}}, and obsolete {{m|de|mehre}}, {{m|de|mehres}}). The superlative ''meist-'' is declined like a normal adjective. ===Adverb=== {{de-adv|mehr|meisten}} # [[much]], [[a lot]] #: {{ux|de|Wir haben '''viel''' gelacht.|t=We laughed a lot.}} ===Derived terms=== * {{l|de|soviel}} * {{l|de|wieviel}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|manch}} [[Category:German suppletive adjectives]] ---- ==Old French== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|fro|VL.|veclus}}, from {{inh|fro|la|vetulus}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|fro|/vieʎ/}} ===Adjective=== {{fro-adj|f=vielle}} # [[old]] ====Declension==== {{fro-decl-adj|ssm=[[vieus]], [[viex]] or [[viels]]|opm=[[vieus]], [[viex]] or [[viels]]|ssf=vielle|osf=vielle|spf=vielles|opf=vielles}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|fro|juene||young}} * {{l|fro|novel||new}} ===Noun=== {{fro-noun|m}} # [[old]] person ====Antonyms==== * {{l|fro|juene||young person}} ====See also==== * {{l|fro|ancien}} ===Descendants=== * {{desc|frm|vieulx}} ** {{desc|fr|vieux}} * {{desc|wa|vî}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== Compare {{cog|de|viel}}, {{cog|nl|veel}}. ===Determiner=== {{head|pdc|determiner|comparative|meh|superlative|menscht}} # [[much]], a lot of
